result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph E Haberberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due by 7/1/2017. Failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Straight time.  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison system.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph E Haberberger

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph E Haberberger not in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.
Proof of death notification received regarding defendant on this date and forwarded to Court for review.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1 -
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 70 DAYS consecutive to any other sentence, straight time with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 70 DAYS.  

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance due by 07-01-2017; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;

Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
  Attorney Garvin Guimont informs court that the defendant is requesting new counsel for reasons placed on the record.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for projected plea and sentencing and status of counsel, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Joseph E Haberberger not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Off record

Defense request for an adjourned plea/sentence date,  as the defendant has a pending revocation hearing, is granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 17  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-24-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court.  Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in custody, not produced. Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for scheduling conference. Court is down.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in court with attorney Vincent Guimont for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in custody.  Ron Dague for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers.

Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  
Defendant Joseph E Haberberger in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
